text: "1. **Annual Report Excerpt (Optimistic Tone, Shareholders)**"
label: Financial

text: "Despite global headwinds, our company's strategic initiatives have driven robust growth. Revenue increased by 15% year-over-year to $120 billion, with adjusted earnings per share rising 18% to $6.50. Our strong cash flow from operations of $21 billion has allowed us to invest in future growth while also returning $7 billion to shareholders through dividends and share repurchases. With a solid balance sheet and a pipeline of innovative products, we remain confident in our long-term prospects."
label: Financial

text: "2. **Banking Report Excerpt (Cautious Tone, Regulators)**"
label: Financial

text: "While the bank's loan portfolio has experienced steady growth, we are monitoring several emerging risks. Credit spreads have widened, indicating potential stress in certain sectors. Additionally, the recent increase in consumer borrowing could lead to higher delinquency rates. To mitigate these risks, we have increased our provision for loan losses and are closely managing our exposure to high-yielding but high-risk assets. We will continue to monitor market conditions and adapt our strategies as needed to maintain our strong capital position."
label: Financial

text: "3. **Personal Budgeting Guide (Informative Tone, Individual Investors)**"
label: Financial

text: "To achieve your financial goals, it's crucial to have a balanced investment portfolio. Consider allocating a portion of your assets to stocks for potential long-term growth, while also including fixed-income securities like bonds for stability. Diversification can help manage risk. For example, investing in a mix of domestic and international equities, as well as different sectors, can help mitigate losses if one area underperforms. Regularly review and rebalance your portfolio to maintain your desired asset allocation."
label: Financial

label: Legal

text: "7. "The parties agree to use reasonable efforts to negotiate in good faith to resolve any disputes that may arise under this agreement."
label: Legal

text: "8. "The court orders the defendant to pay the plaintiff $50,000 in damages for breach of contract."
label: Legal

text: "9. "The parties agree that any intellectual property created during the course of this project shall be the sole property of the employer."
label: Legal

text: "10. "The court grants a preliminary injunction, preventing the defendant from using the trademark pending trial."
label: Legal

text: "11. "The parties agree to comply with the Data Protection Act 2018 in their handling of personal data."
label: Legal

text: "12. "The court grants a writ of mandamus, ordering the public authority to disclose the requested information."
label: Legal

text: "13. "The parties agree to a settlement of $1,000,000 in full satisfaction of all claims related to the motor vehicle accident."
label: Legal

text: "14. "The court rules that the statute of limitations has not expired, and the case may proceed."
label: Legal

text: "15. "The parties agree that any changes to this agreement must be in writing and signed by both parties."
label: Legal

text: "16. "The court finds that the defendant's actions constituted embezzlement, in violation of  501 of the Penal Code."
label: Legal

text: "17. "The parties agree to maintain the confidentiality of any sensitive information disclosed during negotiations."
label: Legal

text: "18. "The court grants a motion to dismiss, finding that the complaint failed to state a claim upon which relief can be granted."
label: Legal

text: "19. "The parties agree to indemnify and hold harmless the other party from any losses arising from their gross negligence or willful misconduct."
label: Legal

text: "20. "The court orders the defendant to pay the plaintiff $100,000 in punitive damages for fraud."
label: Legal

text: "21. "The parties agree to the following terms and conditions, which shall govern their business relationship."
label: Legal

text: "22. "The court rules that the plaintiff's evidence was insufficient to support a finding of negligence."
label: Legal

text: "23. "The parties agree to submit to the jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales for any disputes arising under this agreement."
label: Legal

text: "24. "The court grants a motion to compel discovery, ordering the defendant to respond to the plaintiff's requests for production."
label: Legal

text: "25. "The court rules that the defendant's actions did not constitute a violation of the Competition Act 2002."
label: Legal

text: "26. "The parties agree to a separation of property, with each party retaining their own assets."
label: Legal

text: "27. "The court grants a motion for change of venue, transferring the case to the federal court for the Southern District of New York."
label: Legal

text: "28. "The parties agree to a covenant not to compete, preventing the employee from working for a competitor for a period of two years following termination."
label: Legal

text: "29. "The court grants a motion for class certification, allowing the case to proceed as a class action."
label: Legal

text: "30. "The parties agree to a covenant running with the land, binding future owners to the terms of this agreement."
label: Legal

text: "31. "The court rules that the defendant's actions did not constitute a violation of the Americans with Disabilities Act, 1990."
label: Legal

text: "32. "The parties agree to a confidentiality agreement, preventing the disclosure of any sensitive information."
label: Legal

text: "33. "The court grants a motion for summary judgment on the grounds of res judicata."
label: Legal

text: "34. "The parties agree to a licensing agreement, granting the licensee non-exclusive rights to use the patented technology."
label: Legal

text: "35. "The court rules that the plaintiff's claim is barred by the doctrine of laches due to unreasonable delay."
label: Legal

text: "36. "The parties agree to a liquidated damages clause, providing for a fixed amount to be paid in the event of a breach."
label: Legal

text: "37. "The court grants a motion to bifurcate the trial, separating the issues of liability and damages."
label: Legal

text: "38. "The parties agree to a non-compete agreement, preventing the employee from working for a competitor during employment and for one year thereafter."
label: Legal

text: "39. "The court rules that the defendant's actions constituted a violation of the Telecommunications Act, 1996."
label: Legal

text: "40. "The parties agree to a settlement of $500,000 in full satisfaction of all claims related to the products liability case."
label: Legal

text: "41. "The court grants a motion for default judgment, awarding the plaintiff damages due to the defendant's failure to respond."
label: Legal

text: "42. "The parties agree to a right of first refusal, giving the first party the option to purchase the second party's interest in the property."
label: Legal

text: "43. "The court rules that the defendant's actions did not constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 1970."
label: Legal

text: "44. "The parties agree to a choice of law clause, selecting the laws of the State of New York to govern this agreement."
label: Legal

text: "45. "The court grants a motion to suppress evidence, finding that it was obtained in violation of the defendant's Fourth Amendment rights."
label: Legal

text: "46. "The parties agree to a buyout provision, allowing either party to terminate the agreement and purchase the other party's interest."
label: Legal

text: "47. "The court rules that the plaintiff's claim is barred by the statute of frauds due to the lack of a writing."
label: Legal

text: "48. "The parties agree to a non-disparagement clause, preventing either party from making negative statements about the other."
label: Legal

text: "49. "The court grants a motion for a new trial, finding that the jury's verdict was not supported by substantial evidence."
label: Legal

text: "50. "The parties agree to a severability clause, providing that the invalidity of one provision will not affect the validity of the remaining provisions."
label: Legal

text: "1. **User Guide: Software Installation**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To install our software, download the executable file from our official website, run it, and follow the on-screen prompts. Ensure you have administrative privileges to complete the installation."
label: Technical

text: "2. **Network Configuration: VLAN Setup**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To create a VLAN, first enable VLANs on the switch and assign a VLAN ID. Then, configure switchports to belong to the desired VLAN using the 'switchport mode access' and 'switchport access vlan' commands."
label: Technical

text: "3. **Hardware Design: Component Selection**"
label: Technical

text: "- "When selecting a processor, consider factors such as clock speed, number of cores, and architecture. For this project, we recommend using an Intel Core i7-10700K with a base clock speed of 3.8 GHz."
label: Technical

text: "4. **Cybersecurity Protocol: Encryption Implementation**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To implement encryption, use the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm with a 256-bit key. Ensure that the encryption key is securely generated, stored, and managed throughout its lifecycle."
label: Technical

text: "5. **Troubleshooting Manual: Resolving Connection Issues**"
label: Technical

text: "- "If experiencing connection issues, first check the device's network settings. Ensure that the IP address, subnet mask, and default gateway are correct. If not, renew the IP address using the 'ipconfig /renew' command in Windows or 'dhclient' in Linux."
label: Technical

text: "6. **Software Development: Git Branching**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To create a new feature branch, run 'git checkout -b new-feature'. This command creates a new branch called 'new-feature' and switches your working directory to that branch."
label: Technical

text: "7. **System Architecture Overview: Microservices**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Our system is designed using a microservices architecture, where each service runs in its own process and communicates with lightweight mechanisms such as HTTP/REST."
label: Technical

text: "8. **Engineering Specification: Sensor Calibration**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Calibrate the temperature sensor by exposing it to known temperatures and adjusting the sensor's gain and offset values to match the expected output."
label: Technical

text: "9. **User Guide: Account Creation**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To create an account, click on 'Sign Up' on our homepage, enter your email address and desired password, and follow the verification process."
label: Technical

text: "10. **Network Configuration: Quality of Service (QoS)**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To prioritize voice traffic, configure QoS by setting the priority queue (PQ) to 5 for voice packets and ensuring that the PQ is enabled."
label: Technical

text: "11. **Hardware Design: Component Placement**"
label: Technical

text: "- "For optimal heat dissipation, place the CPU and GPU in the center of the motherboard, away from other components and with clear airflow paths."
label: Technical

text: "12. **Cybersecurity Protocol: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To enable MFA, configure your system to require both a password and a unique code generated by an authentication app or sent via SMS to approve login attempts."
label: Technical

text: "13. **Troubleshooting Manual: Database Connection Errors**"
label: Technical

text: "- "If encountering database connection errors, first check that the database server is running and that the connection string is correct. Verify network connectivity and firewall rules as well."
label: Technical

text: "14. **Software Development: Containerization**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To containerize our application, use Docker. Create a Dockerfile with instructions for building the container image, and then run 'docker build' to create the image."
label: Technical

text: "15. **System Architecture Overview: Scalability**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Our system is designed to be horizontally scalable. To scale, add more instances of the stateless services to the load balancer."
label: Technical

text: "16. **Engineering Specification: Power Management**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Implement power management by using low-power modes during idle time and ensuring that the device can wake up on demand."
label: Technical

text: "17. **User Guide: Password Reset**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To reset your password, click on 'Forgot Password' on the login page, enter your registered email address, and follow the password reset instructions sent to your inbox."
label: Technical

text: "18. **Network Configuration: Site-to-Site VPN**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To configure a site-to-site VPN, first set up the VPN gateway on each site. Then, configure the VPN settings, including the IPsec policy, transform sets, and tunnel interfaces."
label: Technical

text: "19. **Hardware Design: Cable Management**"
label: Technical

text: "- "For optimal airflow and easy maintenance, manage cables by routing them neatly, using cable ties or Velcro straps, and keeping them away from heat sources."
label: Technical

text: "20. **Cybersecurity Protocol: Patch Management**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Implement a patch management system to automatically detect, test, and deploy security patches for all software and systems within your network."
label: Technical

text: "21. **Troubleshooting Manual: Slow Performance**"
label: Technical

text: "- "If experiencing slow performance, check for high CPU or memory usage. Use system monitoring tools to identify resource-intensive processes and optimize or eliminate them."
label: Technical

text: "22. **Software Development: Code Refactoring**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To refactor code, identify duplicated or complex sections, extract them into reusable functions or classes, and simplify the existing code structure."
label: Technical

text: "23. **System Architecture Overview: Caching**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Our system employs caching to improve response times. We use Redis as our caching layer, storing frequently accessed data in memory."
label: Technical

text: "24. **Engineering Specification: Noise Reduction**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To reduce noise, use soundproofing materials in the enclosure design, position fans to minimize airflow turbulence, and consider using quieter components."
label: Technical

text: "25. **User Guide: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To enable 2FA, log in to your account, navigate to the security settings, and follow the prompts to set up 2FA using an authenticator app or hardware token."
label: Technical

text: "26. **Network Configuration: Network Segmentation**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To segment the network, use VLANs or subnets to isolate traffic between different departments or functional areas, improving security and performance."
label: Technical

text: "27. **Hardware Design: Cooling System**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Design the cooling system to include multiple fans, heat sinks, and thermal sensors to monitor temperatures and adjust fan speeds as needed."
label: Technical

text: "28. **Cybersecurity Protocol: Incident Response**"
label: Technical

text: "- "In case of a security incident, follow our incident response plan, which includes containing the breach, eradicating the threat, recovering affected systems, and conducting a post-incident analysis."
label: Technical

text: "29. **Troubleshooting Manual: Blue Screen of Death (BSOD)**"
label: Technical

text: "- "If encountering a BSOD, note the error message, restart the system in safe mode, and use the 'chkdsk' command to check the disk for errors."
label: Technical

text: "30. **Software Development: Error Handling**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Implement robust error handling by using try-catch blocks to handle exceptions, logging errors, and providing meaningful error messages to users."
label: Technical

text: "31. **System Architecture Overview: Data Storage**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Our system uses a distributed storage architecture with a combination of object storage (S3) for static content and relational databases (PostgreSQL) for structured data."
label: Technical

text: "32. **Engineering Specification: EMI Shielding**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To shield against electromagnetic interference (EMI), use electromagnetic shielding materials in the enclosure design and ensure proper grounding and cable shielding."
label: Technical

text: "33. **User Guide: Account Deletion**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To delete your account, log in, navigate to the account settings, and follow the account deletion process. Be aware that this action is irreversible."
label: Technical

text: "34. **Network Configuration: Site-to-Site Tunneling**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To configure site-to-site tunneling, use Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) or IP-in-IP tunneling to connect remote networks and allow traffic to pass through the tunnel."
label: Technical

text: "35. **Hardware Design: Enclosure Design**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Design the enclosure to be modular, allowing easy access to components for maintenance and upgrades. Use Venturi effects to optimize airflow through the enclosure."
label: Technical

text: "36. **Cybersecurity Protocol: Access Control**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Implement role-based access control (RBAC) to limit user access to only the resources and functions required for their job roles, following the principle of least privilege."
label: Technical

text: "37. **Troubleshooting Manual: Boot Failure**"
label: Technical

text: "- "If your system fails to boot, check the BIOS/UEFI settings for any configurable options that might be causing the issue. Ensure that the boot order is correct and that the system can detect the boot device."
label: Technical

text: "38. **Software Development: Unit Testing**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To write unit tests, use a testing framework like Jest or PyTest. Create isolated test cases for each function or method, ensuring that they cover various scenarios and edge cases."
label: Technical

text: "39. **System Architecture Overview: Message Queuing**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Our system uses message queues (RabbitMQ) to enable asynchronous communication between services, decoupling them in time and allowing for better scalability and fault tolerance."
label: Technical

text: "40. **Engineering Specification: EMC Compliance**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To ensure electromagnetic compatibility (EMC), follow industry standards and conduct EMC testing to verify that the device does not emit excessive electromagnetic radiation and is immune to interference from external sources."
label: Technical

text: "41. **User Guide: Account Verification**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To verify your account, click on the verification link sent to your email address upon registration. If you did not receive the email, check your spam folder or request a new verification link."
label: Technical

text: "42. **Network Configuration: Firewall Rules**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To configure firewall rules, first identify the required inbound and outbound traffic. Use a stateful inspection firewall to filter traffic based on application layer protocols and user identity."
label: Technical

text: "43. **Hardware Design: Power Supply**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Design the power supply to be modular, allowing easy upgrades or replacements. Ensure that it has sufficient wattage and efficiency ratings to meet the system's power requirements."
label: Technical

text: "44. **Cybersecurity Protocol: Secure Coding Practices**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Follow secure coding practices, such as validating and sanitizing user input, using parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection, and avoiding cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities."
label: Technical

text: "45. **Troubleshooting Manual: System Frozen**"
label: Technical

text: "- "If your system freezes, first try to recover by pressing Ctrl+Alt+Del and selecting 'Task Manager' to end unresponsive processes. If that fails, perform a hard reboot by holding down the power button for 5 seconds."
label: Technical

text: "46. **Software Development: Code Review**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To conduct a code review, use a code review tool like Gerrit or Phabricator. Follow a structured review process, focusing on code quality, performance, and adherence to coding standards."
label: Technical

text: "47. **System Architecture Overview: Monitoring**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Our system employs monitoring tools like Prometheus and Grafana to collect and visualize key performance indicators (KPIs), ensuring system health and allowing for proactive issue resolution."
label: Technical

text: "48. **Engineering Specification: Human-Machine Interface (HMI)**"
label: Technical

text: "- "Design the HMI to be intuitive and user-friendly, with clear visual feedback and easy-to-use controls. Implement touchscreen support and ensure compatibility with multiple input devices."
label: Technical

text: "49. **User Guide: Account Reactivation**"
label: Technical

text: "- "To reactivate your account, log in to our website, navigate to the account settings, and request account reactivation. Follow the instructions sent to your registered email address."
label: Technical

text: "**Network Configuration: Setting up a Static IP Address on Linux**"
label: Technical

text: "To configure a static IP address on a Linux system, edit the `/etc/network/interfaces` file using a text editor with root privileges. For example, use `sudo nano /etc/network/interfaces`. Add the following lines, replacing the placeholders with your specific values:"
label: Technical

text: "iface eth0 inet static"
label: Technical

text: "dns-nameservers 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4"
label: Technical

text: "**Troubleshooting Manual: Resolving DNS Propagation Issues**"
label: Technical

text: "If you've recently updated your DNS records and are experiencing propagation issues, use the following command to check if the changes have taken effect:"
label: Technical

text: "dig example.com @nameserver_IP"
label: Technical

text: "Replace `example.com` with your domain name and `nameserver_IP` with your nameserver's IP address. The output should display your updated A record."
label: Technical

text: "**Hardware Design: Upgrading Firmware on an ESP32 Microcontroller**"
label: Technical

text: "To upgrade the firmware on an ESP32 microcontroller, follow these steps using the Espressif IDF (Espressif IoT Development Framework):"
label: Technical

text: "1. Connect your ESP32 board to your development computer."
label: Technical

text: "2. Open the IDF command line and navigate to your project directory."
label: Technical

text: "3. Run `idf.py -p [PORT] flash monitor` to flash the new firmware and open a serial monitor. Replace `[PORT]` with your ESP32's serial port (e.g., `/dev/ttyUSB0`)."
label: Technical

text: "**Cybersecurity Protocol: Implementing Encryption at Rest with AES-256**"
label: Technical

text: "To implement AES-256 encryption for data at rest, follow these steps using OpenSSL:"
label: Technical

text: "1. Generate a random 32-byte key for encryption and decryption:"
label: Technical

text: "openssl rand -base64 32 > key.txt"
label: Technical

text: "2. Encrypt your data file using the generated key:"
label: Technical

text: "openssl enc -aes-256-cbc -in data.txt -out encrypted_data.txt -pass file:key.txt"
label: Technical

text: "3. To decrypt the encrypted data file:"
label: Technical

text: "openssl enc -d -aes-256-cbc -in encrypted_data.txt -out decrypted_data.txt -pass file:key.txt"
label: Technical

text: "To enable SSL on your web server, follow these steps:"
label: Technical

text: "1. Generate a private key and a Certificate Signing Request (CSR) using OpenSSL."

text: "openssl req -new -newkey rsa:2048 -nodes -keyout key.pem -out csr.pem"
label: Technical

text: "2. Obtain a certificate from a trusted Certificate Authority (CA) and concatenate it with the CA's intermediate certificate and root certificate."

text: "3. Configure your web server to use the generated key and certificate."

label: Technical

text: "The system architecture follows a microservices pattern, using Docker containers for each service. Services communicate via RESTful APIs, with a central API Gateway for request routing and authentication."
label: Technical

text: "Hardware design requires careful consideration of electromagnetic interference (EMI). Use copper shielding and follow these steps for EMI mitigation: 1. Identify potential noise sources; 2. Implement grounding and filtering strategies; 3. Conduct EMI tests to validate design."

text: "To update the firmware on your device, follow these steps: 1. Download the latest firmware from the support website; 2. Connect your device to the computer; 3. Use the device management software to select 'Firmware Update'; 4. Browse to the downloaded firmware file and click 'Update'; 5. Wait for the update to complete, then reboot the device."
label: Technical

text: "To configure a load balancer, first define your backend servers in the pool. Then, create a virtual IP (VIP) that will distribute incoming traffic across these servers. Use the following command to add servers to the pool: `lb server add <loadBalancerName> <serverIP>:<port>`"
label: Technical

text: "To diagnose high latency issues, enable packet tracing on your network interface. Use the following command: `tcpdump -i <interface> -w <outputFile>`. Analyze the captured packets to identify potential bottlenecks."
label: Technical

text: "The software development process follows Agile methodologies, with bi-weekly sprints and daily stand-up meetings. Use Jira for project management and Git for version control."
label: Technical

text: "To troubleshoot a 'No route to host' error, first check your routing table: `route -n`. Ensure the default gateway is correct. Ping the gateway and trace the route to the destination: `traceroute <destinationIP>`. Identify and fix any network issues."
label: Technical

text: "To set up a VPN for secure remote access, configure a VPN server using OpenVPN. Generate server and client certificates using OpenSSL. Distribute the client configuration file to remote users."
label: Technical

text: "The engineering specification for the new hardware component requires a maximum weight of 5kg, a minimum operating temperature of -20C, and compliance with both CE and RoHS standards."
label: Technical

text: "To optimize database performance, enable indexing on frequently queried columns. Use the following SQL command to create an index: `CREATE INDEX idx_column_name ON table_name(column_name);`"
label: Technical

text: "The system uses a pub/sub architecture for real-time data processing. Producers publish messages to topics, while consumers subscribe to these topics and process incoming data."
label: Technical

text: "To harden the system against SQL injection attacks, use prepared statements and parameterized queries. Avoid dynamic SQL queries constructed using string concatenation."
label: Technical

text: "The software development kit (SDK) provides a set of tools and APIs for integrating our technology into your applications. Refer to the 'Getting Started' guide for installation instructions."
label: Technical

text: "The system uses a multi-tier architecture, with separate tiers for presentation, business logic, and data access. This promotes code maintainability and scalability."
label: Technical

text: "To configure a VPN client on your device, follow these steps: 1. Open 'Network Settings'; 2. Select 'VPN'; 3. Choose 'OpenVPN'; 4. Enter the VPN server address and credentials; 5. Connect to the VPN."
label: Technical

text: "The engineering team is responsible for designing and implementing the system's hardware components. Follow the guidelines in the 'Hardware Design Document' for component selection and integration."
label: Technical

text: "To implement two-factor authentication (2FA), integrate a third-party 2FA service API into your application. Follow the provider's documentation for API key generation and integration."
label: Technical

text: "The system's architecture includes a message queue for asynchronous processing of tasks. Use the following command to produce a message: `producer.send('topic_name', 'message_body')`"
label: Technical

text: "To optimize Java performance, enable Just-In-Time (JIT) compilation. Add the following line to your JVM options: `-XX:+UseJITCompilation`"
label: Technical

text: "The system uses a microservices architecture, with each service running in its own container. Use the following command to build a Docker image: `docker build -t <imageName> .`"
label: Technical

text: "**Network Configuration for Reduced Latency**"
label: Technical

text: "To minimize latency in your network, consider the following configurations:"
label: Technical

text: "1. **Enable Quality of Service (QoS)** on your router to prioritize latency-sensitive traffic."
label: Technical

text: "2. **Use a wired connection** for critical devices and applications, as Wi-Fi can introduce variable latency."
label: Technical

text: "3. **Reduce the number of network hops** by placing your router closer to your devices or using network extenders."
label: Technical

text: "4. **Consider using a network switch** to connect multiple devices, reducing the load on your router."
label: Technical

text: "**Encryption Key Management in Our System**"
label: Technical

text: "Our system uses AES-256 encryption for data at rest and in transit. The encryption keys are managed using a Hardware Security Module (HSM) following these procedures:"
label: Technical

text: "1. **Key Generation**: Keys are generated within the HSM to ensure their randomness and security."
label: Technical

text: "2. **Key Storage**: Keys are stored securely within the HSM, never leaving its protected environment."
label: Technical

text: "3. **Key Use**: Keys are used for encryption and decryption within the HSM, with no plaintext keys ever exposed."
label: Technical

text: "4. **Key Rotation**: Keys are rotated every 90 days, with new keys generated and old keys securely deleted."
label: Technical

text: "**Setting Up a GitHub Repository for Version Control**"
label: Technical

text: "To start using Git for version control, follow these steps to set up a new repository on GitHub:"
label: Technical

text: "1. Log in to your GitHub account."
label: Technical

text: "2. Click the '+' icon in the upper right corner and select 'New repository'."
label: Technical

text: "3. Name your repository (e.g., 'my-project'), write a short description, and click 'Create repository'."
label: Technical

text: "4. Initialize a local git repository on your computer using the command `git init`."
label: Technical

text: "5. Add your project files to the local repository using `git add .`."
label: Technical

text: "6. Commit your changes with a meaningful commit message using `git commit -m "Initial commit"`."
label: Technical

text: "**Troubleshooting Common USB Device Connection Issues**"
label: Technical

text: "If your USB device is not connecting correctly, try the following troubleshooting steps:"
label: Technical

text: "1. **Check the USB cable and port**:"
label: Technical

text: "- Ensure the cable is properly connected at both ends."
label: Technical

text: "- Try using a different USB port on your computer."
label: Technical

text: "- Use a different USB cable to rule out cable issues."
label: Technical

text: "2. **Restart the device and your computer**:"
label: Technical

text: "- Disconnect the USB device and turn it off."
label: Technical

text: "- Restart your computer."
label: Technical

text: "- Reconnect the USB device and turn it back on."
label: Technical

text: "3. **Check Device Manager (Windows) or System Information (macOS)**:"
label: Technical

text: "- Look for any error messages or indicators that the device is not installed correctly."
